sense.name: arrangement of objects
sense.commentary: A particular arrangement of some group of objects or people, in which they form a continuous, often-horizontal line. Does not refer to events in time.
sense.examples: Put all the cards in a neat row. In Microsoft Excel, the cells are arranged in rows and columns. I see a row of clouds in the sky, and you see a row of chairs on the ground. The people are standing in a row. When you're building a house, you arrange the bricks in rows. She went to the opera and got a seat in the front row.

sense.name: argument
sense.commentary: ROW[+event] A slightly old-fashioned way of referring to a heated argument or dispute.
sense.examples: My wife and I had a nasty row about whether to get paper or plastic. I could hear the sounds of your row from the other room.

sense.name: consecutive events
sense.commentary: A particular "arrangement" of events in time; a series of events that occur consecutively or without interruption.
sense.examples: They won the championship three years in a row. He knocked seven times in a row.

sense.name: act of rowing
sense.commentary: ROW[+event] An act of rowing a boat. Sometimes refers to the sport of rowing.
sense.examples: Yesterday I took a row around the river. The oars are too heavy for me to make a good row. John built a row boat with his bare hands. He tried joining the row team yesterday, but he didn't make the cut.
